abstract: Stocks of Nokia and Ericsson, struggling Scandinavian cellphone companies, surge following reports of better-than expected financial results; Nokia reports third-quarter loss of $93.6 million , while Ericsson reports sales of $8.4 billion.
snippet: The two struggling Scandinavian technology companies benefited from growing sales in developing markets.
lead_paragraph: The two struggling Scandinavian technology companies benefited from growing sales in developing markets.

headline.main: Results Beat Expectations at Ericsson and Nokia
headline.print_headline: Results Beat Expectations At Ericsson And Nokia
headline.seo: Nokia and Ericsson Post Better-Than-Expected Results
